name: The Ultimate The Money Pit Quiz |   Movies

questions.text: Who plays the lead characters Walter Fielding Jr. and Anna Crowley?
questions.explanation:
Shelley Long and Tom Hanks.

	The chemistry created between these two translated into magic on the screen.

questions.text: What was the name of the band that Walter represented, that wanted to change their name?
questions.explanation:
Cheap Girls.

	This group of characters were men who dressed as women.  They wanted to change their name to Meryl Streep, however, Walter warned them of the possibility of a lawsuit.

questions.text: Walter and Anna purchased the house for ___________ ?
questions.explanation:
$200,000.

	Jack Schnittman, the overweight realtor, said that this house just came on the market and that it was a million dollar home.  Walter said he thought that it had to be to good to be true, he was right.

questions.text: What was the name of Anna's ex-husband, played by Alexander Godunov?
questions.explanation:
Max.

	Max was conceited and full of himself.  He was known as the Maestro to the orchestra members.  Alexander Godunov died of alcohol poisoning in 1995.

questions.text: What were the names of the contractors who worked on the house?
questions.explanation:
Shirk Brothers.

	Art and Brad Shirk ran a carpentry and plumbing business.  Every time anyone would ask when something would be done they would all say "two weeks".

questions.text: How much money had Walter Fielding Sr. stolen from his clients?
questions.explanation:
$2.9 million

	Walter says this amount when he is reading the letter from his father at the beginning of the movie, telling him of his new marriage.

questions.text: "For everyone who's ever been deeply in love or deeply in debt" is the tagline for this movie.
Richard Benjamin wrote and directed this film.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He only directed the film.  David Giler wrote the film.  He also has writing credits for "Fun with Dick and Jane" (1977); "Southern Comfort" (1981); "Aliens" (1986).

questions.text: What was the name of the young rock star that Walter went to to borrow the money to buy the house?
questions.explanation:
Benny.

	Walter wanted Benny to loan him the $200,000 because he helped him save five times that much in taxes that year.  He had to talk to him like a child to get what he wanted.

questions.text: When Walter was stuck in the floor the first night, after repairs were started on the house, what did he say he thought that he saw during an hallucination?
questions.explanation:
The Care Bears.

	He was counting the money for the permit man and he fell through a hole in the floor and got stuck.  This is one of the funnier scenes in the film.
